metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10810 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the virtio_gpu_object_create function in drivers/gpu/drm/virtio/virtgpu_object.c in the Linux kernel through 4.11.8 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by triggering object-initialization failures. 李强 discovered that the Virtio GPU driver in the Linux kernel did not properly free memory in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (memory consumption).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-89-generic - 4.4.0-89.112~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-89-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-89.112~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-89-lowlatency - 4.4.0-89.112~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-89-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-89.112~14.04.1

No subscription required
